abstract.p: Leon W Zelby letter on crash of Concorde (July 29 article) suggests that inflatable landing-gear tires be replaced by solid ones

block.p: Re ''Concorde Investigators Focus on Blown Tire'' (news article, July 29): The recent Concorde tragedy, as well as some of the previous mishaps with inflatable landing-gear tires, suggests that maybe the inflatable tires should be replaced by solid ones, even if they're more expensive.

Re ''Concorde Investigators Focus on Blown Tire'' (news article, July 29): The recent Concorde tragedy, as well as some of the previous mishaps with inflatable landing-gear tires, suggests that maybe the inflatable tires should be replaced by solid ones, even if they're more expensive.

Unlike the wheels used for ground transportation that provide propulsion and, possibly, improved ride comfort, landing-gear wheels provide transition from flight to a solid surface. Solid wheels in this case would be not much different from landing skis on snow or pontoons on water. A blown tire on landing is a less than pleasant experience even on a light, single-engine aircraft, as I can vouch from experience.
LEON W. ZELBY Norman, Okla., July 31, 2000
